greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Levenshtein distance between n considered as a decimal string and n considered as a binary string.
comment: a(n) = minimal number of editing steps (delete, insert or substitute) to transform n_10 into n_2.
link: Michael Gilleland, Levenshtein Distance [It has been suggested that this algorithm gives incorrect results sometimes. - _N. J. A. Sloane_]
mathematica: levenshtein[s_List, t_List] := Module[{d, n = Length@s, m = Length@t}, Which[s === t, 0, n == 0, m, m == 0, n, s != t, d = Table[0, {m + 1}, {n + 1}]; d[[1, Range[n + 1]]] = Range[0, n]; d[[Range[m + 1], 1]] = Range[0, m]; Do[d[[j + 1, i + 1]] = Min[d[[j, i + 1]] + 1, d[[j + 1, i]] + 1, d[[j, i]] + If[s[[i]] === t[[j]], 0, 1]], {j, m}, {i, n}]; d[[ -1, -1]]]];
xref: Cf. A000027, A007088, first occurrence: A115778.
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 26 2006
